comments: Multiplied by 10 this is 2/sqrt(3). - _Alonso del Arte_, Apr 30 20122/sqrt(3) is Hermite's constant gamma_2. - _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Sep 02 2014, after Steven Finch.
links: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Steven R. Finch, Errata and Addenda to Mathematical Constants, p. 62.
Yining Hu, Patterns in numbers and infinite sums and products, arXiv:1506.00151 [math.NT], 2015.
formula: (csc(Pi/3))/10, where csc is the cosecant function. - _Alonso del Arte_, Apr 30 2012Product_{n>=1} ((3*n+1)/(3*n+2))^((-1)^n)), with offset 1. (see Hu link). - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 02 2015
crossrefs: Cf. A010153 (continued fraction, but missing the initial 0).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
